arabicText: ۞ أَلَمْ تَرَ إِلَى ٱلَّذِينَ نَافَقُوا۟ يَقُولُونَ لِإِخْوَٰنِهِمُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ مِنْ أَهْلِ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ لَئِنْ أُخْرِجْتُمْ لَنَخْرُجَنَّ مَعَكُمْ وَلَا نُطِيعُ فِيكُمْ أَحَدًا أَبَدًۭا وَإِن قُوتِلْتُمْ لَنَنصُرَنَّكُمْ وَٱللَّهُ يَشْهَدُ إِنَّهُمْ لَكَـٰذِبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Did	you	not	see	the	hypocrites,	that	they	
say	to	their	disbelieving	brothers	among	
the	People	given	the	Book(s),	“If	you	are	
expelled,	then	we	will	definitely	go	out	
with	you,	and	we	will	not	listen	to	anyone	
in	your	matters,	and	if	you	are	fought	
against	we	will	surely	help	you”;	and	Allah	
testifies	that	they	are	indeed	liars.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kya	tum	ne	munāfiqoñ	ko	na	dekha	ke	
apne	bhaiyoñ	kāfir	kitābiyoñ	se	kehte	
haiñ	ke	agar	tum	nikāle	gaye	to	zaroor	
hum	tumhāre	sāth	nikal	jāyeñ	ge	aur	
hargiz	tumhāre	bāre	meiñ	kabhi	kisi	ki	na	
māneñ	ge	aur	tum	se	ladayi	huyi	to	hum	
zaroor	tumhāri	madad	kareñge	aur	Allah	
gawah	hai	ke	woh	jhoote	haiñ.

arabicText: لَئِنْ أُخْرِجُوا۟ لَا يَخْرُجُونَ مَعَهُمْ وَلَئِن قُوتِلُوا۟ لَا يَنصُرُونَهُمْ وَلَئِن نَّصَرُوهُمْ لَيُوَلُّنَّ ٱلْأَدْبَـٰرَ ثُمَّ لَا يُنصَرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
If	they	are	expelled,	the	hypocrites	will	
not	go	out	with	them;	and	if	they	are	
fought	against	they	will	not	help	them;	
and	even	if	they	were	to	help	them,	they	
would	turn	their	backs	and	flee;	and	then	
they	will	not	be	helped.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Agar	woh	nikāle	gaye	to	yeh	unke	sāth	na	
nikleñ	ge	aur	un	se	ladayi	huyi	to	yeh	unki	
madad	na	kareñge	aur	agar	unki	madad	ki	
bhi	to	zaroor	peeth	pher	kar	bhāgeñ	ge	
phir	madad	na	pāayeñ		ge.

arabicText: لَأَنتُمْ أَشَدُّ رَهْبَةًۭ فِى صُدُورِهِم مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ قَوْمٌۭ لَّا يَفْقَهُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	in	their	hearts	is	a	greater	fear	of	
you	than	that	of	Allah;	this	is	because	they	
are	a	people	who	do	not	understand.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak		unke	diloñ		meiñ	Allah	se	ziyada	
tumhāra	dar	hai	yeh	is	liye	ke	woh	na	
samajh	log	haiñ.

arabicText: لَا يُقَـٰتِلُونَكُمْ جَمِيعًا إِلَّا فِى قُرًۭى مُّحَصَّنَةٍ أَوْ مِن وَرَآءِ جُدُرٍۭ ۚ بَأْسُهُم بَيْنَهُمْ شَدِيدٌۭ ۚ تَحْسَبُهُمْ جَمِيعًۭا وَقُلُوبُهُمْ شَتَّىٰ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ قَوْمٌۭ لَّا يَعْقِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
They	will	not	fight	you	even	if	they	all	
come	together,	except	in	barricaded	cities	
or	from	behind	walls;	they	are	severe	
fighters	among	themselves;	you	will	
assume	them	to	be	one,	whereas	their	
hearts	are	divided;	this	is	because	they	are	a	people	who	do	not	have	any	sense.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yeh	sab	mil	kar	bhi	tum	se	na	ladeñ	ge	
magar	qila	band	shehroñ	meiñ	ya	dhusoñ	
(Diwāroñ)	ke	peechhe	āapas	meiñ	unki	āañch	sakht	hai	tum	unheiñ	ek	jat-tha	(Jamā’at)	
samjhoge	aur	unke	dil	alag	alag	haiñ	yeh	is	liye	ke	woh	be-‘aql	log	haiñ.

arabicText: كَمَثَلِ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ قَرِيبًۭا ۖ ذَاقُوا۟ وَبَالَ أَمْرِهِمْ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Like	the	example	of	those	who	were	before	them	not	long	ago	-	they	tasted	the	evil	result	of	
their	deeds;	and	for	them	is	a	painful	punishment.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Unki	si	kahawat	jo	abhi	qareeb	zamāne	meiñ	un	se	pehle	they	unhoñ	ne	apne	kām	ka	wabāl	
chakhā	aur	unke	liye	dard-nāk	‘aƶāb	hai.

arabicText: كَمَثَلِ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنِ إِذْ قَالَ لِلْإِنسَـٰنِ ٱكْفُرْ فَلَمَّا كَفَرَ قَالَ إِنِّى بَرِىٓءٌۭ مِّنكَ إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ ٱللَّهَ رَبَّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
The	example	of	the	devil	-	when	he	said	to	man	“Disbelieve”;	so	when	he	has	rejected	faith,	he	
says,	“I	am	unconcerned	with	you	-	indeed	I	fear	Allah,	the	Lord	of	The	Creation.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Shaitān	ki	kahawat	jab	us	ne	āadmi	se	kahā	kufr	kar	phir	jab	us	ne	kufr	kar	liya	bola	maiñ	tujh	
se	alag	hooñ	maiñ	Allah	se	darta	hooñ	jo	sāre	jahāñ	ka	Rab.

arabicText: فَكَانَ عَـٰقِبَتَهُمَآ أَنَّهُمَا فِى ٱلنَّارِ خَـٰلِدَيْنِ فِيهَا ۚ وَذَٰلِكَ جَزَٰٓؤُا۟ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
So	the	fate	of	them	both	is	that	they	are	
both	in	the	fire,	to	remain	in	it	forever;	
and	this	is	the	proper	punishment	for	the	
unjust.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	un	donoñ	ka	anjām	yeh	huwa	ke	woh	
donoñ	āag	meiñ	haiñ	hamesha	us	meiñ	
raheñ	aur	zālimoñ	ki	yehi	saza	hai

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَلْتَنظُرْ نَفْسٌۭ مَّا قَدَّمَتْ لِغَدٍۢ ۖ وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ خَبِيرٌۢ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
O	People	who	Believe!	Fear	Allah,	and	
every	soul	must	see	what	it	has	sent	
ahead	for	tomorrow;	and	fear	Allah;	
indeed	Allah	is	Aware	of	your	deeds.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	Imān	wālo	Allah	se	daro	aur	har	jān	
dekhe	ke	kal	ke	liye	kya	āage	bheja	aur	
Allah	se	daro	be-shak	Allah	ko	tumhāre	
kāmoñ	ki	khabar	hai.

arabicText: وَلَا تَكُونُوا۟ كَٱلَّذِينَ نَسُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ فَأَنسَىٰهُمْ أَنفُسَهُمْ ۚ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْفَـٰسِقُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	do	not	be	like	those	who	forgot	Allah	–	He	therefore	put	them	into	hardship	
making	them	forget	themselves;	it	is	they	
who	are	the	sinners.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	un	jaise	na	ho	jo	Allah	ko	bhool	baithe	
to	Allah	ne	unheiñ	balā	meiñ	dāla	ke	apni	
jāneiñ	yād	na	rahiñ	wohi	fāsiq	haiñ.

arabicText: لَا يَسْتَوِىٓ أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلنَّارِ وَأَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلْجَنَّةِ ۚ أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلْجَنَّةِ هُمُ ٱلْفَآئِزُونَ
englishTranslationText:
The	People	of	hell	and	the	People	of	
Paradise	are	not	equal;	it	is	only	the	
People	of	Paradise	who	have	succeeded.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Dozakh	wāle	aur	Jannat	wāle	barābar	nahi	
Jannat	wāle	hi	murād	ko	pahuñche.

arabicText: لَوْ أَنزَلْنَا هَـٰذَا ٱلْقُرْءَانَ عَلَىٰ جَبَلٍۢ لَّرَأَيْتَهُۥ خَـٰشِعًۭا مُّتَصَدِّعًۭا مِّنْ خَشْيَةِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ وَتِلْكَ ٱلْأَمْثَـٰلُ نَضْرِبُهَا لِلنَّاسِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَفَكَّرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Had	We	sent	down	this	Qur’an	upon	a	
mountain,	you	would	have	then	surely	
seen	it	bowed	down,	blown	to	bits	by	the	
fear	of	Allah;	and	We	illustrate	such	
examples	for	people,	for	them	to	ponder.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Agar	hum	yeh	Qur’ān	kisi	pahād	par	
utārte	to	zaroor	tu	usey	dekhta	jhuka	
huwa	pāsh	pāsh	hota	Allah	ke	khauf	se	
aur	yeh	misāleñ	logoñ	ke	liye	hum	bayān	
farmāte	haiñ	ke	woh	socheñ.

arabicText: هُوَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِى لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۖ عَـٰلِمُ ٱلْغَيْبِ وَٱلشَّهَـٰدَةِ ۖ هُوَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ ٢٢
englishTranslationText:
It	is	Allah,	except	Whom	there	is	no	God;	
the	Knowing	of	all	–	the	hidden	and	the	
evident;	He	only	is	the	Most	Gracious,	the	
Most	Merciful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Wohi	Allah	hai	jiske	siwa	koi	ma'bood	
nahi	har	nihāñ-wa-‘ayāñ	(Chupi	wa	zahir)	
ka	jānne	wāla	wohi	hai	badā	maherbān	
rehmat	wāla.

arabicText: هُوَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِى لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ٱلْمَلِكُ ٱلْقُدُّوسُ ٱلسَّلَـٰمُ ٱلْمُؤْمِنُ ٱلْمُهَيْمِنُ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْجَبَّارُ ٱلْمُتَكَبِّرُ ۚ سُبْحَـٰنَ ٱللَّهِ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
englishTranslationText:
It	is	Allah,	except	Whom	there	is	no	God;	
the	King,	the	Pure,	the	Giver	of	Peace,	the	Bestower	of	Safety,	the	Protector,	the	Most	
Honourable,	the	Compeller,	the	Proud;	Purity	is	to	Allah	from	all	what	they	ascribe	as	partners	
(to	Him)!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Wohi	hai	Allah	jiske	siwa	koi	ma'bood	
nahi	bādshāh	nihayat	pāk	salāmati	dene	wāla	amān	bakhshne	wāla	hifāzat	farmāne	wāla	‘izzat	
wāla	azmat	wāla	takabbur	wāla	Allah	ko	pāki	hai	unke	shirk	se.

arabicText: هُوَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْخَـٰلِقُ ٱلْبَارِئُ ٱلْمُصَوِّرُ ۖ لَهُ ٱلْأَسْمَآءُ ٱلْحُسْنَىٰ ۚ يُسَبِّحُ لَهُۥ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
It	is	Allah	only,	Who	is	the	Creator,	the	Initiator,	the	Designer	of	all	–	His	only	are	all	the	good	
names;	all	whatever	is	in	the	heavens	and	in	the	earth	proclaims	His	Purity;	and	He	only	is	the	
Most	Honourable,	the	Wise.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Wohi	hai	Allah	banāne	wāla	paida	karne	wāla	har	ek	ko	soorat	dene	wāla	usi	ke	haiñ	sab	achche	
nām	uski	pāki	bolta	hai	jo	kuch	āasmānoñ	aur	zameen	meiñ	hai	aur	Wohi	‘Izzat	wa	Hikmat	wāla	
hai.

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ لَا تَتَّخِذُوا۟ عَدُوِّى وَعَدُوَّكُمْ أَوْلِيَآءَ تُلْقُونَ إِلَيْهِم بِٱلْمَوَدَّةِ وَقَدْ كَفَرُوا۟ بِمَا جَآءَكُم مِّنَ ٱلْحَقِّ يُخْرِجُونَ ٱلرَّسُولَ وَإِيَّاكُمْ ۙ أَن تُؤْمِنُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ رَبِّكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ خَرَجْتُمْ جِهَـٰدًۭا فِى سَبِيلِى وَٱبْتِغَآءَ مَرْضَاتِى ۚ تُسِرُّونَ إِلَيْهِم بِٱلْمَوَدَّةِ وَأَنَا۠ أَعْلَمُ بِمَآ أَخْفَيْتُمْ وَمَآ أَعْلَنتُمْ ۚ وَمَن يَفْعَلْهُ مِنكُمْ فَقَدْ ضَلَّ سَوَآءَ ٱلسَّبِيلِ
englishTranslationText:
O	People	who	Believe!	Do	not	befriend	My	
and	your	enemy	-	you	reveal	secrets	to	
them	out	of	friendship	whereas	they	
disbelieve	in	the	truth	which	has	come	to	
you!	It	is	they	who	remove	the	Noble	
Messenger	and	you	from	your	homes,	
upon	your	believing	in	Allah,	your	Lord;	if	
you	have	come	out	to	fight	for	My	cause,	
and	to	gain	My	pleasure,	then	do	not	
befriend	them;	you	send	them	secret	
messages	of	friendship	–	and	I	well	know	
all	what	you	hide	and	all	what	you	
disclose;	and	whoever	among	you	does	it,	
has	indeed	strayed	away	from	the	right	
path.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	Imān	wālo	Mere	aur	apne	dushmanoñ	
ko	dost	na	banāo	tum	unheiñ	khabreiñ	
pahuñchāte	ho	dosti	se	halāñke	woh	
munkir	haiñ	us	haq	ke	jo	tumhāre	pās	āaya	
ghar	se	juda	karte	haiñ	Rasool	ko	aur	
tumheiñ		is	par	ke	tum	apne	Rab	Allah	par	
imān	lāye	agar	tum	nikle	ho	meri	rāh	meiñ	
jihād	karne	aur	meri	raza	chāhne	ko	to	
unse	dosti	na	karo	tum	unheiñ	khufya	
payām	mahabbat	ka	bhejte	ho	aur	maiñ	
khoob	jānta	hooñ	jo	tum	chhupāo	aur	jo	
zāhir	karo	aur	tum	meiñ	jo	aisa	kare	woh	
be-shak		seedhi	rāh	se	behka.

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ لَا تَتَّخِذُوا۟ عَدُوِّى وَعَدُوَّكُمْ أَوْلِيَآءَ تُلْقُونَ إِلَيْهِم بِٱلْمَوَدَّةِ وَقَدْ كَفَرُوا۟ بِمَا جَآءَكُم مِّنَ إِن يَثْقَفُوكُمْ يَكُونُوا۟ لَكُمْ أَعْدَآءًۭ وَيَبْسُطُوٓا۟ إِلَيْكُمْ أَيْدِيَهُمْ وَأَلْسِنَتَهُم بِٱلسُّوٓءِ وَوَدُّوا۟ لَوْ تَكْفُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
If	they	gain	dominance	over	you	they	will	
be	your	enemies,	and	will	extend	their	
hands	and	their	tongues	towards	you	with	
evil,	and	they	wish	that	in	some	way	you	
turn	disbelievers.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Agar	tumheiñ	pāayeñ	to	tumhāre	dushman	
honge	aur	tumhāri	taraf	apne	hāth	aur	
apni	zubāneiñ	burāyi	ke	sāth	darāz	
kareñge	aur	unki	tamanna	hai	ke	kisi	tarah	
tum	kāfir	ho	jāo.

arabicText: لَن تَنفَعَكُمْ أَرْحَامُكُمْ وَلَآ أَوْلَـٰدُكُمْ ۚ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ يَفْصِلُ بَيْنَكُمْ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ بَصِيرٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Neither	your	relations	nor	your	offspring	
will	in	the	least	benefit	you,	on	the	Day	of	
Resurrection;	He	will	separate	you	from	
them;	and	Allah	is	seeing	your	deeds.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Hargiz	kām	na	āayeñ	ge	tumheiñ		tumhāre	
rishte	aur	na	tumhāri	aulād	Qiyamat	ke	
din	tumheiñ	unse	alag	kar	dega	aur	Allah	
tumhāre	kām	dekh	raha	hai.

arabicText: قَدْ كَانَتْ لَكُمْ أُسْوَةٌ حَسَنَةٌۭ فِىٓ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ وَٱلَّذِينَ مَعَهُۥٓ إِذْ قَالُوا۟ لِقَوْمِهِمْ إِنَّا بُرَءَٰٓؤُا۟ مِنكُمْ وَمِمَّا تَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ كَفَرْنَا بِكُمْ وَبَدَا بَيْنَنَا وَبَيْنَكُمُ ٱلْعَدَٰوَةُ وَٱلْبَغْضَآءُ أَبَدًا حَتَّىٰ تُؤْمِنُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ وَحْدَهُۥٓ إِلَّا قَوْلَ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ لِأَبِيهِ لَأَسْتَغْفِرَنَّ لَكَ وَمَآ أَمْلِكُ لَكَ مِنَ ٱللَّهِ مِن شَىْءٍۢ ۖ رَّبَّنَا عَلَيْكَ تَوَكَّلْنَا وَإِلَيْكَ أَنَبْنَا وَإِلَيْكَ ٱلْمَصِيرُ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	in	Ibrahim,	and	those	along	with	him,	
lay	a	good	example	for	you	follow	-	when	they	
said	to	their	people,	“Indeed	we	are	unconcerned	with	you	and	all	what	you	worship	besides	Allah;	we	
reject	you,	and	between	us	and	you	has	surfaced	enmity	and	hatred	for	ever	until	you	accept	faith	in	the	
One	Allah”	–	except	the	saying	of	Ibrahim	to	his	father,	“I	will	surely	seek	forgiveness	for	you,	and	I	do	not	
possess	any	power	to	benefit	you	against	Allah”;	“O	our	Lord!	We	have	relied	only	upon	You,	and	towards	
You	only	we	have	inclined	and	only	towards	You	is	the	return”.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	tumhāre	liye	achchhi	pairwi	thi	
Ibraheem	aur	uske	sāth	waloñ	meiñ	jab	
unhoñ	ne	apni	qaum	se	kahā	be-shak		hum	
bezār	haiñ	tum	se	aur	unse	jinheiñ	Allah	
ke	siwa	poojte	ho	hum	tumhāre	munkir	
huwe	aur	hum	meiñ	aur	tum	meiñ	dushmani	aur	‘adawat	zāhir	ho	gayi	hamesha	ke	liye	jab	tak	
tum	ek	Allah	par	imān	na	lāo	magar	Ibraheem	ka	apne	bāp	se	kehna	ke	maiñ	zaroor	teri	
maghfirat	chāhoñ	ga	aur	maiñ	Allah	ke	sāmne	tere	kisi	nafa'	ka	mālik	nahi	aey	hamāre	Rab	Hum	
ne	tujhi	par	bharosa	kiya	aur	teri	hi	taraf	ruju’	lāye	aur	teri	hi	taraf	phirna	hai.

arabicText: رَبَّنَا لَا تَجْعَلْنَا فِتْنَةًۭ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ وَٱغْفِرْ لَنَا رَبَّنَآ ۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
“O	our	Lord!	Do	not	put	us	into	the	trial	of	the	disbelievers,	and	forgive	us,	O	our	Lord!	Indeed	
You	only	are	the	Most	Honourable,	the	Wise.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	hamāre	Rab	Hameiñ	kāfiroñ	ki	āazmāish	meiñ	na	dāl	aur	hameiñ	bakhsh	de	aey	hamāre	
Rab	Be-shak	tu	hi	‘Izzat-wa-Hikmat	wāla	hai

arabicText: لَقَدْ كَانَ لَكُمْ فِيهِمْ أُسْوَةٌ حَسَنَةٌۭ لِّمَن كَانَ يَرْجُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَٱلْيَوْمَ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَ ۚ وَمَن يَتَوَلَّ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ هُوَ ٱلْغَنِىُّ ٱلْحَمِيدُ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	in	them	lay	a	good	example	for	you	
to	follow	–	for	one	who	looks	forward	to	
(meeting)	Allah	and	the	Last	Day;	and	
whoever	turns	away	–	then	(know	that)	
indeed	Allah	only	is	the	Independent,	the	
Most	Praiseworthy.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	tumhāre	liye	un	meiñ	achchhi	
pairwi	thi	usey	jo	Allah	aur	pichhle	din	ka	
ummeed-wār	ho	aur	jo	moñh	phere	to	be
shak	Allah	hi	be-niyāz	hai	sab	khoobiyoñ	
sarāha

arabicText: ۞ عَسَى ٱللَّهُ أَن يَجْعَلَ بَيْنَكُمْ وَبَيْنَ ٱلَّذِينَ عَادَيْتُم مِّنْهُم مَّوَدَّةًۭ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ قَدِيرٌۭ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ غَفُورٌۭ رَّحِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
It	is	likely	that	Allah	may	create	friendship	
between	you	and	those	among	them	who	
are	now	your	enemies;	and	Allah	is	All	
Able;	and	Allah	is	Oft	Forgiving,	Most	
Merciful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Qareeb	hai	ke	Allah	tum	meiñ	aur	un	meiñ	
jo	un	meiñ	se	tumhāre	dushman	haiñ	
dosti	karde	aur	Allah	qādir	hai	aur	bakhsh	
ne	wāla	maherbān	hai

arabicText: لَّا يَنْهَىٰكُمُ ٱللَّهُ عَنِ ٱلَّذِينَ لَمْ يُقَـٰتِلُوكُمْ فِى ٱلدِّينِ وَلَمْ يُخْرِجُوكُم مِّن دِيَـٰرِكُمْ أَن تَبَرُّوهُمْ وَتُقْسِطُوٓا۟ إِلَيْهِمْ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُحِبُّ ٱلْمُقْسِطِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Allah	does	not	forbid	you	from	those	who	
did	not	fight	against	you	because	of	
religion	and	did	not	drive	you	out	from	
your	homes,	that	you	should	be	kind	
towards	them	and	deal	with	them	fairly;	
indeed	the	equitable	are	the	beloved	of	
Allah.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allah	tumheiñ	unse	man’a	nahi	karta	jo	
tum	se	deen	meiñ	na	lade	aur	tumheiñ		
tumhāre	gharoñ	se	na	nikāla	ke	unke	sāth	
ehsān	karo	aur	unse	insāf		ka	bartāo	barto	
be-shak	insāf	wāle	Allah	ko	Mehboob	
haiñ.

arabicText: إِنَّمَا يَنْهَىٰكُمُ ٱللَّهُ عَنِ ٱلَّذِينَ قَـٰتَلُوكُمْ فِى ٱلدِّينِ وَأَخْرَجُوكُم مِّن دِيَـٰرِكُمْ وَظَـٰهَرُوا۟ عَلَىٰٓ إِخْرَاجِكُمْ أَن تَوَلَّوْهُمْ ۚ وَمَن يَتَوَلَّهُمْ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلظَّـٰلِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Allah	forbids	you	only	from	those	who	
fought	against	you	because	of	religion	or	
drove	you	out	from	your	homes	or	helped	
others	to	drive	you	out,	that	you	should	
befriend	them;	and	whoever	befriends	
them	–	it	is	they	who	are	the	unjust.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allah	tumheiñ		unhiñ	se	man’a	karta	hai	jo	
tum	se	deen	meiñ	lade	ya	tumheiñ		
tumhāre	gharoñ	se	nikāla	ya	tumhāre	
nikālne	par	madad	ki	ke	unse	dosti	karo	
aur	jo	unse	dosti	kare	to	wohi	sitam-gār	
haiñ.

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِذَا جَآءَكُمُ ٱلْمُؤْمِنَـٰتُ مُهَـٰجِرَٰتٍۢ فَٱمْتَحِنُوهُنَّ ۖ ٱللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ بِإِيمَـٰنِهِنَّ ۖ فَإِنْ عَلِمْتُمُوهُنَّ مُؤْمِنَـٰتٍۢ فَلَا تَرْجِعُوهُنَّ إِلَى ٱلْكُفَّارِ ۖ لَا هُنَّ حِلٌّۭ لَّهُمْ وَلَا هُمْ يَحِلُّونَ لَهُنَّ ۖ وَءَاتُوهُم مَّآ أَنفَقُوا۟ ۚ وَلَا جُنَاحَ عَلَيْكُمْ أَن تَنكِحُوهُنَّ إِذَآ ءَاتَيْتُمُوهُنَّ أُجُورَهُنَّ ۚ وَلَا تُمْسِكُوا۟ بِعِصَمِ ٱلْكَوَافِرِ وَسْـَٔلُوا۟ مَآ أَنفَقْتُمْ وَلْيَسْـَٔلُوا۟ مَآ أَنفَقُوا۟ ۚ ذَٰلِكُمْ حُكْمُ ٱللَّهِ ۖ يَحْكُمُ بَيْنَكُمْ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ حَكِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
O	People	who	Believe!	When	Muslim	
women	leave	the	lands	of	disbelief	and	
migrate	towards	you,	examine	them;	Allah	
knows	more	about	their	faith;	so	if	you	
judge	the	women	to	be	believers,	do	not	
send	them	back	to	the	disbelievers;	
neither	are	they	lawful	for	the	
disbelievers,	nor	are	the	disbelievers	lawful	for	them;	and	give	their	disbelieving	husbands	
what	they	had	spent;	and	there	is	no	sin	upon	you	to	marry	them	if	you	give	them	their	bridal	
money;	and	do	not	continue	the	marriage	with	disbelieving	women	-	and	ask	for	what	you	had	
spent,	and	the	disbelievers	may	ask	for	what	they	had	spent;	this	is	Allah’s	command;	He	judges	
between	you;	and	Allah	is	All	Knowing,	Wise.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	Imān	wālo	Jab	tumhāre	pās	
Musalman	aurteiñ	kufristān	se	apne	ghar	
chord	kar	āayeñ	to	unka	imtehān	kar	lo	
Allah	unke	Imān	ka	hāl	behtar	jānta	hai	
phir	agar	woh	tumheiñ	Imān	wāliyañ	
m’aloom	hoñ	to	unheiñ	kāfiroñ	ko	wāpas	
na	do	na	yeh	unheiñ	halāl	na	woh	inheiñ	
halāl	aur	unke	kāfir	shauharoñ	ko	dedo	jo	
unka	kharch	huwa	aur	tum	par	kuch	
gunah	nahi	ke	unse	nikah	karlo	jab	unke	
maher	unheiñ	do	aur	kāfirniyoñ	ke	nikah	par	jame	na	raho	aur	māñg	lo	jo	tumhāra	kharch	
huwa	aur	kāfir	māñg	leiñ	jo	unhoñ	ne	kharch	kiya	yeh	Allah	ka	ḥukm		hai	woh	tum	meiñ	faisla	
farmāta	hai	aur	Allah	ilm-o-hikmat	wāla	hai.

arabicText: وَإِن فَاتَكُمْ شَىْءٌۭ مِّنْ أَزْوَٰجِكُمْ إِلَى ٱلْكُفَّارِ فَعَاقَبْتُمْ فَـَٔاتُوا۟ ٱلَّذِينَ ذَهَبَتْ أَزْوَٰجُهُم مِّثْلَ مَآ أَنفَقُوا۟ ۚ وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَنتُم بِهِۦ مُؤْمِنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	if	some	women	go	away	from	the	Muslims	to	the	disbelievers	-	then	when	you	punish	the	
disbelievers,	give	from	the	war	booty	to	the	Muslims	who	lost	their	wives	the	amount	they	had	
spent;	and	fear	Allah	in	Whom	you	believe.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	Musalmanoñ	ke	hāth	se	unki	kuch	aurteiñ	kāfiroñ	ki	taraf	nikal	jāyeñ	phir	tum	kāfiroñ		
ko	sazā	do	to	jinki	aurteiñ	jāti	rahi	theiñ	ghanimat	meiñ	se	unheiñ	utna	dedo	jo	unka	kharch	
huwa	tha	aur	Allah	se	daro	jis	par	tumheiñ	Imān	hai.

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّبِىُّ إِذَا جَآءَكَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنَـٰتُ يُبَايِعْنَكَ عَلَىٰٓ أَن لَّا يُشْرِكْنَ بِٱللَّهِ شَيْـًۭٔا وَلَا يَسْرِقْنَ وَلَا يَزْنِينَ وَلَا يَقْتُلْنَ أَوْلَـٰدَهُنَّ وَلَا يَأْتِينَ بِبُهْتَـٰنٍۢ يَفْتَرِينَهُۥ بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِنَّ وَأَرْجُلِهِنَّ وَلَا يَعْصِينَكَ فِى مَعْرُوفٍۢ ۙ فَبَايِعْهُنَّ وَٱسْتَغْفِرْ لَهُنَّ ٱللَّهَ ۖ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَفُورٌۭ رَّحِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
O	dear	Prophet	(Muhammad	–	peace	and	
blessings	be	upon	him)!	If	Muslim	women	
come	humbly	to	you	to	take	oath	of	
allegiance	that	they	will	neither	ascribe	
any	partner	to	Allah,	nor	steal,	nor	
commit	adultery,	nor	kill	their	children,	
nor	bring	the	lie	that	they	carry	between	
their	hands	and	feet,	nor	disobey	you	in	
any	rightful	matter	-	then	accept	their	
allegiance	and	seek	forgiveness	from	
Allah	for	them;	indeed	Allah	is	Oft	
Forgiving,	Most	Merciful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	Nabi	Jab	tumhāre	huzoor	Musalman	
aurteiñ	hāzir	hoñ	is	par	bai'at	karne	ko	ke	
Allah	ka	shareek	kuchh	na	thehrayeñ	gi	
aur	na	chori	kareñgi	aur	na	bad-kāri	aur	
na	apni	aulād	ko	qatl	kareñgi	aur	na	woh	
bohtān	lāayeñ		gi	jise	apne	hāthoñ	aur	
pāoñ	ke	darmiyān	yāni	mauz-e-wiladat	
meiñ	uthayeñ	aur	kisi	nek	bāt	meiñ	
tumhāri	na-farmāni	na	kareñgi	to	unse	
bai'at	lo	aur	Allah	se	unki	maghfirat	chāho	
be-shak	Allah	bakhshne	wāla	maherbān	
hai.

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ لَا تَتَوَلَّوْا۟ قَوْمًا غَضِبَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيْهِمْ قَدْ يَئِسُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ كَمَا يَئِسَ ٱلْكُفَّارُ مِنْ أَصْحَـٰبِ ٱلْقُبُورِ
englishTranslationText:
O	People	who	Believe!	Do	not	befriend	the	
people	upon	whom	is	Allah’s	wrath	–	they	
have	lost	hope	in	the	Hereafter	the	way	
the	disbelievers	have	lost	hope	in	the	
people	of	the	graves.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	Imān	wālo	Un	logoñ	se	dosti	na	karo	
jin	par	Allah	ka	ghazab	hai	woh	Āakhirat	
se	āas	tod	baithe	haiñ	jaise	kāfir	āas	tod	
baithe	qabr	waloñ		se.

arabicText: سَبَّحَ لِلَّهِ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
All	whatever	is	in	the	heavens	and	all	
whatever	is	in	the	earth	proclaims	the	
Purity	of	Allah;	and	He	only	is	the	Most	
Honourable,	the	Wise.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allah	ki	pāki	bolta	hai	jo	kuchh	āasmānoñ	
meiñ	hai	aur	jo	kuchh	zameen	meiñ	hai	
aur	wohi	Ízzat-o-Hikmat	wāla	hai

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ لِمَ تَقُولُونَ مَا لَا تَفْعَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
O	People	who	Believe!	Why	do	you	
preach	what	you	do	not	practice?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	Imān	wālo	Kyuñ	kehte	ho	woh	jo	
nahi	karte

arabicText: كَبُرَ مَقْتًا عِندَ ٱللَّهِ أَن تَقُولُوا۟ مَا لَا تَفْعَلُونَ
englishTranslationText: How	despicable	it	is	in	the	sight	of	Allah	that	you	may	preach	what	you	do	not	practice.
romanUrduTranslationText: Kitni	sakht	na	pasand	hai	Allah	ko	woh	bāt	ke	woh	kaho	jo	na	karo

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُحِبُّ ٱلَّذِينَ يُقَـٰتِلُونَ فِى سَبِيلِهِۦ صَفًّۭا كَأَنَّهُم بُنْيَـٰنٌۭ مَّرْصُوصٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	Allah	likes	those	who	fight	in	His	cause,	positioned	in	rows,	as	if	they	were	an	edifice	
fortified.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Beshak	Allah	dost	rakhta	hai	unheiñ	jo	uski	rāh	meiñ	ladte	haiñ	parā	(saf)	bāñdh	kar	goya	woh	
imārat	haiñ	rānga	(shisha)	pilāyi

arabicText: وَإِذْ قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِقَوْمِهِۦ يَـٰقَوْمِ لِمَ تُؤْذُونَنِى وَقَد تَّعْلَمُونَ أَنِّى رَسُولُ ٱللَّهِ إِلَيْكُمْ ۖ فَلَمَّا زَاغُوٓا۟ أَزَاغَ ٱللَّهُ قُلُوبَهُمْ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ لَا يَهْدِى ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱلْفَـٰسِقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	remember	when	Moosa	said	to	his	people,	“O	my	people!	Why	do	you	trouble	me,	
whereas	you	know	that	I	am	Allah’s	Noble	Messenger	towards	you?”	So	when	they	deviated,	
Allah	deviated	their	hearts;	and	Allah	does	not	guide	the	sinning	people.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	yād	karo	jab	Mūsā	ne	apni	qaum	se	kahā	aey	meri	qaum	mujhe	kyuñ	satāte	ho	halāñke	tum	
jānte	ho	ke	maiñ	tumhāri	taraf	Allah	ka	Rasool	hooñ	phir	jab	woh	tedhe	huwe	Allah	ne	unke	dil	
tedhe	kar	diye	aur	fāsiq	logoñ	ko	Allah	rāh	nahi	deta.

arabicText: وَإِذْ قَالَ عِيسَى ٱبْنُ مَرْيَمَ يَـٰبَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ إِنِّى رَسُولُ ٱللَّهِ إِلَيْكُم مُّصَدِّقًۭا لِّمَا بَيْنَ يَدَىَّ مِنَ ٱلتَّوْرَىٰةِ وَمُبَشِّرًۢا بِرَسُولٍۢ يَأْتِى مِنۢ بَعْدِى ٱسْمُهُۥٓ أَحْمَدُ ۖ فَلَمَّا جَآءَهُم بِٱلْبَيِّنَـٰتِ قَالُوا۟ هَـٰذَا سِحْرٌۭ مُّبِينٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	remember	when	Eisa	the	son	of	
Maryam	said,	“O	Descendants	of	Israel!	
Indeed	I	am	Allah’s	Noble	Messenger	
towards	you,	confirming	the	Book	Torah	
which	was	before	me,	and	heralding	glad	
tidings	of	the	Noble	Messenger	who	will	
come	after	me	–	his	name	is	Ahmed	(the	
Praised	One)”;	so	when	Ahmed	came	to	
them	with	clear	proofs,	they	said,	“This	is	
an	obvious	magic.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	yād	karo	jab	'Isa	bin	Maryam	ne	kahā	
aey	bani	Isra’il	maiñ	tumhāri	taraf	Allah	
ka	Rasool	hooñ	apne	se	pehli	Kitāb	
Taurait	ki	tasdeeq	karta	huwa	aur	un	
Rasool	ki	basharat	sunāta	huwa	jo	mere	
b’ad	tashreef	lāyeñge	unka	nām	Ahmad	
hai	phir	jab	Ahmad	unke	pās	raushan	
nishāniyāñ	lekar	tashreef	lāye	bole	yeh	
khula	jādu	hai

arabicText: وَمَنْ أَظْلَمُ مِمَّنِ ٱفْتَرَىٰ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ٱلْكَذِبَ وَهُوَ يُدْعَىٰٓ إِلَى ٱلْإِسْلَـٰمِ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ لَا يَهْدِى ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	who	is	more	unjust	than	one	who	
fabricates	a	lie	against	Allah	whereas	he	is	
being	called	towards	Islam?	And	Allah	
does	not	guide	the	unjust	people.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	us	se	badh	kar	zālim	kaun	jo	Allah	par	
jhoot	bāñdhe	halāñke	usey	islam	ki	taraf	
bulāya	jāta	ho	aur	zālim	logoñ	ko	Allah	
rāh	nahi	deta.

arabicText: يُرِيدُونَ لِيُطْفِـُٔوا۟ نُورَ ٱللَّهِ بِأَفْوَٰهِهِمْ وَٱللَّهُ مُتِمُّ نُورِهِۦ وَلَوْ كَرِهَ ٱلْكَـٰفِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
They	wish	to	put	out	Allah’s	light	with	their	
mouths,	whereas	Allah	will	perfect	His	light	
even	if	the	disbelievers	get	annoyed.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Chāhte	haiñ	ke	Allah	ka	Noor	apne	
muñhoñ	se	bujha	deiñ	aur	Allah	ko	apna	
Noor	poora	karna	pade	bura	māneiñ	kāfir.

arabicText: هُوَ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَرْسَلَ رَسُولَهُۥ بِٱلْهُدَىٰ وَدِينِ ٱلْحَقِّ لِيُظْهِرَهُۥ عَلَى ٱلدِّينِ كُلِّهِۦ وَلَوْ كَرِهَ ٱلْمُشْرِكُونَ
englishTranslationText:
It	is	He	Who	has	sent	His	Noble	
Messenger	with	guidance	and	the	religion	
of	truth,	in	order	that	He	may	make	it	
prevail	over	all	other	religions,	even	if	the	
polytheists	get	annoyed.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Wohi	hai	jisne	apne	Rasool	ko	hidāyat	aur	
sachche	deen	ke	sāth	bheja	ke	usey	sab	
deenoñ	par	ghalib	kare	pade	bura	māneiñ	
mushrik.

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ هَلْ أَدُلُّكُمْ عَلَىٰ تِجَـٰرَةٍۢ تُنجِيكُم مِّنْ عَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
O	People	who	Believe!	Shall	I	show	you	a	
trade	that	can	save	you	from	the	painful	
punishment?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	Imān	wālo	Kya	main	batā	dooñ	woh	
saudāgari	jo	tumheiñ	dard-nāk	‘ažãb	se	
bacha	le.

arabicText: تُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِۦ وَتُجَـٰهِدُونَ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ بِأَمْوَٰلِكُمْ وَأَنفُسِكُمْ ۚ ذَٰلِكُمْ خَيْرٌۭ لَّكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Have	faith	in	Allah	and	His	Noble	
Messenger,	and	fight	in	Allah’s	cause	with	
your	wealth	and	your	lives;	this	is	better	
for	you,	if	you	understand.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Imān	rakho	Allah	aur	uske	Rasool	par	aur	
Allah	ki	rāh	meiñ	apne	māl-wa-jān	se	
Jihād	karo	yeh	tumhāre	liye	behtar	hai	
agar	tum	jāno.

arabicText: يَغْفِرْ لَكُمْ ذُنُوبَكُمْ وَيُدْخِلْكُمْ جَنَّـٰتٍۢ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ وَمَسَـٰكِنَ طَيِّبَةًۭ فِى جَنَّـٰتِ عَدْنٍۢ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلْفَوْزُ ٱلْعَظِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
He	will	forgive	you	your	sins	and	admit	you	
into	Gardens	beneath	which	rivers	flow,	and	
superb	dwellings	in	everlasting	Gardens	of	
Eden;	this	is	the	greatest	success.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	tumhāre	gunah	bakhsh	dega	aur	
tumheiñ	bāghoñ	meiñ	le	jāyega	jinke	
neeche	nehreiñ	rawāñ	aur	pakeeza	
mehelloñ	meiñ	jo	basne	ke	bāghoñ	meiñ	
haiñ	yehi	badi	kāmyābi	hai.

arabicText: وَأُخْرَىٰ تُحِبُّونَهَا ۖ نَصْرٌۭ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَفَتْحٌۭ قَرِيبٌۭ ۗ وَبَشِّرِ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	He	will	give	you	another	favour,	which	is	dear	to	you	–	the	help	from	Allah	and	an	imminent	
victory;	and	O	dear	Prophet	(Muhammad	–	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him),	give	glad	tidings	to	the	
Muslims.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ek	ne’mat	tumheiñ	aur	dega	jo	
tumheiñ	piyāri	hai	Allah	ki	madad	aur	jald	āane	wāli	fatah	aur	aey	Mehboob	Musalmanoñ	ko	
khushi	suna	do.

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ كُونُوٓا۟ أَنصَارَ ٱللَّهِ كَمَا قَالَ عِيسَى ٱبْنُ مَرْيَمَ لِلْحَوَارِيِّـۧنَ مَنْ أَنصَارِىٓ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ ۖ قَالَ ٱلْحَوَارِيُّونَ نَحْنُ أَنصَارُ ٱللَّهِ ۖ فَـَٔامَنَت طَّآئِفَةٌۭ مِّنۢ بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ وَكَفَرَت طَّآئِفَةٌۭ ۖ فَأَيَّدْنَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ عَلَىٰ عَدُوِّهِمْ فَأَصْبَحُوا۟ ظَـٰهِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
O	People	who	Believe!	Become	the	aides	of	Allah’s	religion,	the	way	Eisa	the	son	of	Maryam	had	said	
to	the	disciples,	“Who	will	help	me,	inclining	towards	Allah?”	The	disciples	said,	“We	are	the	aides	of	
Allah’s	religion”	–	so	a	group	among	the	Descendants	of	Israel	accepted	faith	and	another	group	
disbelieved;	We	therefore	aided	the	believers	against	their	enemies,	so	they	were	victorious.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	Imān	wālo	Deen-e-Khuda	ke	madad-gār	ho	jaise	Isā	bin	Maryam	ne	hawāriyoñ	se	kahā	tha	
kaun	haiñ	jo	Allah	ki	taraf	hokar	meri	madad	kareiñ	hawāri	bole	hum	Deen-e-Khuda	ke	madad
gār	haiñ	to	bani	Isra’il	se	ek	giroh	Imān	lāya	aur	ek	giroh	ne	kufr	kiya	to	hum	ne	Imān	wāloñ	ko	
unke	dushmanoñ	par	madad	di	to	ghalib	ho	gaye.

arabicText: يُسَبِّحُ لِلَّهِ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ٱلْمَلِكِ ٱلْقُدُّوسِ ٱلْعَزِيزِ ٱلْحَكِيمِ
englishTranslationText:
All	whatever	is	in	the	heavens	and	all	
whatever	is	in	the	earth	proclaims	the	
Purity	of	Allah,	the	King,	the	Most	Pure,	the	
Most	Honourable,	the	Wise.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	Imān	wālo	Deen-e-Khuda	ke	madad-gār	ho	jaise	Isā	bin	Maryam	ne	hawāriyoñ	se	kahā	tha	
kaun	haiñ	jo	Allah	ki	taraf	hokar	meri	madad	kareiñ	hawāri	bole	hum	Deen-e-Khuda	ke	madad
gār	haiñ	to	bani	Isra’il	se	ek	giroh	Imān	lāya	aur	ek	giroh	ne	kufr	kiya	to	hum	ne	Imān	wāloñ	ko	
unke	dushmanoñ	par	madad	di	to	ghalib	ho	gaye.

arabicText: هُوَ ٱلَّذِى بَعَثَ فِى ٱلْأُمِّيِّـۧنَ رَسُولًۭا مِّنْهُمْ يَتْلُوا۟ عَلَيْهِمْ ءَايَـٰتِهِۦ وَيُزَكِّيهِمْ وَيُعَلِّمُهُمُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ وَٱلْحِكْمَةَ وَإِن كَانُوا۟ مِن قَبْلُ لَفِى ضَلَـٰلٍۢ مُّبِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
It	is	He	Who	has	sent	among	the	
unlettered	people	a	Noble	Messenger	
from	themselves,	who	recites	His	verses	
to	them	and	purifies	them,	and	bestows	
them	the	knowledge	of	the	Book	and	
wisdom;	and	indeed	before	this,	they	
were	in	open	error.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Wohi	hai	jisne	an-padhoñ	meiñ	unhiñ	
meiñ	se	ek	Rasool	bheja	ke	un	par	uski	
āayateiñ	padhte	haiñ	aur	unheiñ	pāk	karte	
haiñ	aur	unheiñ	kitāb	aur	hikmat	ka	
‘ilm‘ata	farmāte	haiñ	aur	beshak	woh	is	se	
pehle	zaroor	khuli	gumrahi	meiñ	they

arabicText: وَءَاخَرِينَ مِنْهُمْ لَمَّا يَلْحَقُوا۟ بِهِمْ ۚ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
And	he	(the	Holy	Prophet)	bestows	
knowledge	to	others	along	with	them,	
who	have	not	yet	joined	them;	and	He	
only	is	the	Most	Honourable,	the	Wise.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	un	meiñ	se	auroñ	ko	pāk	karte	aur	
Ílm‘ata	farmāte	haiñ	jo	un	agloñ	se	na	mile	
aur	Wohi	‘Izzat-o-Hikmat	wāla	hai

arabicText: ذَٰلِكَ فَضْلُ ٱللَّهِ يُؤْتِيهِ مَن يَشَآءُ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ ذُو ٱلْفَضْلِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
englishTranslationText:
This	is	Allah’s	munificence,	which	He	may	
give	to	whomever	He	wills;	and	Allah	is	
Extremely	Munificent.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yeh	Allah	ka	fazl	hai	jise	chāhe	de	aur	Allah	
bade	fazl	wāla	hai.

arabicText: مَثَلُ ٱلَّذِينَ حُمِّلُوا۟ ٱلتَّوْرَىٰةَ ثُمَّ لَمْ يَحْمِلُوهَا كَمَثَلِ ٱلْحِمَارِ يَحْمِلُ أَسْفَارًۢا ۚ بِئْسَ مَثَلُ ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ لَا يَهْدِى ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
The	example	of	those	who	were	entrusted	
with	the	Taurat,	and	did	not	carry	out	its	
commands,	is	like	the	donkey	carrying	
books;	what	a	wretched	example	is	of	the	
people	who	denied	the	signs	of	Allah;	and	
Allah	does	not	guide	the	unjust.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Unki	misāl	jin	par	Taurait	rakhi	gayi	thi	
phir	unhoñ	ne	uski	hukm	bardāri	na	ki	
gadhe	ki	misāl	hai	jo	peeth	par	kitābeiñ	
uthāye	kya	hi	buri	misāl	hai	un	logoñ	ki	
jinhoñ	ne	Allah	ki	Āayateiñ	jhutlayiñ	aur	
Allah	zālimoñ	ko	rāh	nahi	deta

arabicText: قُلْ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ هَادُوٓا۟ إِن زَعَمْتُمْ أَنَّكُمْ أَوْلِيَآءُ لِلَّهِ مِن دُونِ ٱلنَّاسِ فَتَمَنَّوُا۟ ٱلْمَوْتَ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰدِقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Say	“O	Jews!	If	you	assume	that	you	are	Allah’s	friends,	others	are	not,	then	wish	for	death	if	you	
are	truthful!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāo	aey	Yahūdiyo	Agar	tumheiñ	
yeh	gumān	hai	ke	tum	Allah	ke	dost	ho	aur	
log	nahi	to	marne	ki	āarzu	karo	agar	tum	sachche	ho

arabicText: وَلَا يَتَمَنَّوْنَهُۥٓ أَبَدًۢا بِمَا قَدَّمَتْ أَيْدِيهِمْ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ عَلِيمٌۢ بِٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	they	will	never	wish	for	it	because	of	the	misdeeds	their	hands	have	sent	ahead;	and	Allah	
well	knows	the	unjust.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh	kabhi	iski	āarzu	na	kareñge	un	kotakoñ	(a’amāl)	ke	sabab	jo	unke	hāth	āage	bhej	chuke	
haiñ	aur	Allah	zālimoñ	ko	jānta	hai

arabicText: قُلْ إِنَّ ٱلْمَوْتَ ٱلَّذِى تَفِرُّونَ مِنْهُ فَإِنَّهُۥ مُلَـٰقِيكُمْ ۖ ثُمَّ تُرَدُّونَ إِلَىٰ عَـٰلِمِ ٱلْغَيْبِ وَٱلشَّهَـٰدَةِ فَيُنَبِّئُكُم بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad	–	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him),	“Indeed	death	which	
you	run	away	from	will	surely	confront	you,	then	you	will	be	returned	to	Him	Who	knows	all	
the	hidden	and	the	visible	-	He	will	then	inform	you	of	what	you	did.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāo	woh	maut	jis	se	tum	bhagte	ho	woh	to	zaroor	tumheiñ	milni	hai	phir	uski	taraf	
phere	jāoge	jo	chhupa	aur	zāhir	sab	kuch	jānta	hai	phir	who	tumheiñ	bata	dega	jo	tum	ne	kiya	
tha

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِذَا نُودِىَ لِلصَّلَوٰةِ مِن يَوْمِ ٱلْجُمُعَةِ فَٱسْعَوْا۟ إِلَىٰ ذِكْرِ ٱللَّهِ وَذَرُوا۟ ٱلْبَيْعَ ۚ ذَٰلِكُمْ خَيْرٌۭ لَّكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
O	People	who	Believe!	When	the	call	for	
prayer	is	given	on	(Friday)	the	day	of	
congregation,	rush	towards	the	
remembrance	of	Allah	and	stop	buying	
and	selling;	this	is	better	for	you	if	you	
understand.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	Imān	wālo	Jab	Namāz	ki	azān	ho	
Jumu’ah	ke	din	to	Allah	ke	zikr	ki	taraf	
daudo	aur	khareed-o-farokht	chord	do	
yeh	tumhāre	liye	behtar	hai	agar	tum	
jāno.

arabicText: فَإِذَا قُضِيَتِ ٱلصَّلَوٰةُ فَٱنتَشِرُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَٱبْتَغُوا۟ مِن فَضْلِ ٱللَّهِ وَٱذْكُرُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ كَثِيرًۭا لَّعَلَّكُمْ تُفْلِحُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	the	prayer	ends,	spread	out	in	
the	land	and	seek	Allah’s	munificence,	and	
profusely	remember	Allah,	in	the	hope	of	
attaining	success.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	jab	Namāz	ho	chuke	to	zameen	meiñ	
phail	jāo	aur	Allah	ka	fazl	talāsh	karo	aur	
Allah	ko	bahut	yād	karo	is	ummeed	par	ke	
falāh	pāo.

arabicText: وَإِذَا رَأَوْا۟ تِجَـٰرَةً أَوْ لَهْوًا ٱنفَضُّوٓا۟ إِلَيْهَا وَتَرَكُوكَ قَآئِمًۭا ۚ قُلْ مَا عِندَ ٱللَّهِ خَيْرٌۭ مِّنَ ٱللَّهْوِ وَمِنَ ٱلتِّجَـٰرَةِ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ خَيْرُ ٱلرَّٰزِقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	they	see	some	trade	or	sport,	
they	move	towards	it	and	leave	you	
standing	delivering	the	sermon;	proclaim,	
“That	which	is	with	Allah,	is	better	than	
sport	and	trade;	and	the	sustenance	of	
Allah	is	the	best.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	unhoñ	ne	koi	tijārat	ya	khel	dekha	
uski	taraf	chal	diye	aur	tumheiñ	khutbe	
meiñ	khada	chord	gaye	tum	farmāo	woh	
jo	Allah	ke	pās	hai	khel	se	aur	tijārat	se	
behtar	hai	aur	Allah	ka	rizq	sab	se	achcha.

arabicText: إِذَا جَآءَكَ ٱلْمُنَـٰفِقُونَ قَالُوا۟ نَشْهَدُ إِنَّكَ لَرَسُولُ ٱللَّهِ ۗ وَٱللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ إِنَّكَ لَرَسُولُهُۥ وَٱللَّهُ يَشْهَدُ إِنَّ ٱلْمُنَـٰفِقِينَ لَكَـٰذِبُونَ
englishTranslationText:
When	the	hypocrites	come	in	your	
presence	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad	-	
peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him)	they	say,	
“We	testify	that	you	surely	are	Allah’s	
Noble	Messenger”;	and	Allah	knows	that	
you	indeed	are	His	Noble	Messenger,	and	
Allah	testifies	that	the	hypocrites	are	
indeed	liars.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jab	munāfiq	tumhāre	huzoor	hāzir	hote	
haiñ	kehte	haiñ	ke	hum	gawāhi	dete	haiñ	
ke	Huzoor	beshak	yaqeenan	Allah	ke	
Rasool	haiñ	aur	Allah	jānta	hai	ke	tum	
uske	Rasool	ho	aur	Allah	gawāhi	deta	hai	
ke	munāfiq	zaroor	jhoote	haiñ.
